main.speakText: Oh no! Burns aren't any fun. Follow these steps to help someone who has a small burn. Is the scene safe?
main.title: Burns

yes.speakText: Get the first aid kit. If you don't have a first aid kit, get a dry, non-stick sterile or clean dressing. Wear protective gloves if you have them. Cool the burn area immediately with cold, but not ice-cold, water for at least 10 minutes. If you do not have cold water, use a cool or cold, but not freezing, clean compress. Run cold water on the burn until it doesn't hurt. You may then cover the burn with a dry, nonstick sterile or clean dressing. The only things you should put on a burn are cold water and clean dressings. If the pain persists, see a healthcare provider as soon as possible. I hope your patient feels a little better. What else can I help you with?
